page.title: 02Getting around the Lenches
page.content: The Wychavon Way from Droitwich to Winchcombe passes through the area from north to south, near Sheriffs Lench. Efforts are being made by the local farmers to make slight changes in the route, as it passes through good arable land. They wish to change the path so that it follows the field boundaries. One of the spectacular visual interests of each year is blossom time in the Vale. Tourists can follow the Blossom Route by car from nearby Harvington ,through Atch Lench,and Church Lench to view the plum,damson and a little later the apple orchards. Another feature of this area is the timber-framed and thatched cottages, which are well preserved.
